page.title: 17HELP FOR HEDGEHOGS_KNOWBURY
page.content: In 1981, a Councillor, who lives in Knowbury, took an interest in {hedgehogs.}He decided to put ramps into cattle grids, so that if hedgehogs and small animals fell in, they could escape. When news of{ {hedgehog ramps}reached people, money was sent to him at Knowbury House. It couldn't be returned because none of the letters were addressed. Other causes couldn't benefit because it had been sent especially for hedgehogs. So{The British Hedgehog {Preservation Society}was founded. Nobody knows much about hedgehogs, so some of the money went towards research, which was done by a professor in London. Now money is raised for the society by selling T-shirts, cuddly toys and hedgehog flavoured crisps. The society has donated Â£1,000+ to help the research.
